section.heading: Definitions.
section.text: For the purposes of this chapter, the term:

para.text: “Authorized personnel” means an individual who has access to Districtwide assessment materials or is directly involved in the administration of a Districtwide assessment.
“Districtwide assessments” shall have the same meaning as provided in § 38-1800.02(13).
“IEP” means a student’s individualized education program.
“Local education agency” or “LEA” means the District of Columbia Public Schools system or any individual or group of public charter schools operating under a single charter.

“Test monitor” means an individual designated by a local education agency to be responsible for testing integrity and security at each individual school subject to the LEA’s control during the administration of a Districtwide assessment.
“OSSE” means the Office of the State Superintendent of Education.

“Test integrity coordinator” means an individual designated by a LEA to be responsible for testing integrity and security for the LEA in its entirety during the administration of a Districtwide assessment.
“Testing integrity and security agreement” means an agreement developed by OSSE that:
Sets forth requirements for ensuring integrity of Districtwide assessments pursuant to District law and regulation; and

Requires the signatory to acknowledge that he or she understands that knowingly and willingly violating a District law, regulation, or a test security plan could result in civil liability, including the loss of an OSSE granted certification or license.
